phrases.thai:
Q: kin khâaw rʉ́yaŋ (eat rice yet)
(+) kin lɛɛw (eat already)
(-) yaŋ mâi kin (yet not eating)
phrases.english:
Q: Have you eaten yet?
A: +/-

phrases.thai:
Q: pen yaŋŋay bâaŋ (to be how some)
(+): sa baay dii (kh.)
(-): mâi sa baay (kh.)
phrases.english:
Q: How are you doing?
A: +/-

phrases.thai:
Q: pay nǎy maa (go where come)
A: pay ___ maa (kh.)
phrases.english:
Q: Where have you been?
A: I've been to ___

What is your name?
My name is ___

phrases.thai:
khun pen khon (prathêet) ʔaray (you to be person/people country what)
phǒm pen khon ___

Q1: sabaay dii mây
Q2: pen yaŋŋay bâaŋ (to be how some)
A: sabaay dii mâak
A: sabaay dii
A: kɔ̂ɔ dii
A: rʉ̂ay rʉ̂ay
A: mây khɔ̂y dii
A: yêe mâak
phrases.english:
Q: How are you? (2 options)
A: Great, very well
A: Fine, good
A: Okay, alright
A: So so
A: Pretty bad
A: Terrible
Excuse me; I have to go now
Excuse me; I have some errands to run
Excuse me; Talk to you later
